title: Widow of nurse, 49, slams report after NHS missed her cervical cancer six times

The widow of a long-serving nurse who died after doctors missed her cancer six times has slammed an NHS report into her care as 'lamentable'.

Kevin O'Connor, whose 49-year-old wife Julie died in February, has condemned the official review into her death as 'lamentable from start to finish'.

The document reportedly found that Mrs O’Connor had been failed by North Bristol NHS Trust on more than one occasion.

She finally find out she had a 1.8in tumour when she went to a private doctor in 2017.

(Image: FACEBOOK)

(Image: Bristol Post)

The new report into her death does not look back further than 2017 - and therefore does not cover a mis-read smear test in 2014 or her five subsequent hospital visits, the Daily Mail reports.

Kevin O'Connor slammed the 'downright obvious' findings of the probe, which was published seven months late.

He told the Daily Mail: "This report was a good opportunity to capture the serious failings in cervical screening which have lain dormant for years.

(Image: FACEBOOK/Kevin OConnor)

"Unfortunately the report is a lamentable job from start to finish. It misses the root cause and fails to put in place the barriers and safeguards to protect other women.

"I’m not out to nail anybody, crucify anyone, I can’t change the past – just God forbid if anything happened to anyone else."

The 30-page document, which was handed to the Daily Mail but has not been publicly released, found there were at least two missed chances to spot Mrs O'Connor's abnormal cervical cells.

(Image: FACEBOOK/Kevin OConnor)

(Image: Bristol Post/SWNS)

It also condemned 'serious errors and subsequent failings' in the care of Mrs O'Connor, who was an NHS nurse for 13 years.

The review's author, Dr Mike Durkin, said the trust's investigation had not been carried out in a timely fashion and was 'too limited' in scope.

North Bristol NHS Trust told the Daily Mail it was determined to learn from the case and had made 'significant changes' around cervical cancer tests.
description: A new report into the death of Julie O'Connor found that she was 'failed' by the NHS
